ratings.comment: Brenner is a brilliant and insightful professor. She is wildly intelligent and kind and genuinely cares for her students, but she can be very short and come off as judgemental on occasion. Lots of readings and short papers due before each class, but it wasn't unbearable. Would definitely recommend her as a professor, but you have to put in effort.

Professor Brenner is a wildly intelligent teacher and scholar and I learned a lot from her and her class. That being said, she can be extremely curt and short with students who do not understand what she is attempting to convey. She lacks true patience when students are attempting to reason with her regarding certain issues in her class.
Lots to learn, though Prof Brenner is very particular about doing things her way (ie lectures outside of class). Only 1 exam. Pretty good.

Professor Brenner is brilliant. I definitely learned a lot in her course. Unfortunately, I still wouldn't recommend her to others. She is the first instructor I have ever had who goes beyond the occasional rude comment. She can genuinely be cruel, and she takes things very personally. It is impossible to reason with her if she is upset.

Was a ton of work (readings due before each class period) but she grades very fairly and as long as you put in the work you'll get in A. We were forced to attend 2 mandatory outside lectures during the day while many of us had class, but she made the last one optional for extra credit. She's very passionate and you will definitely learn a lot.

She required us to attend 3 lectures outside of designated class time. The lectures were all during the day, when most of us had other classes. She told us if we had another class, we had to miss it or we wouldn't get points. Very smart woman but not very understanding/compassionate

Jewish Studies 231 is a great class. Professor Brenner only gives a few tests and a few papers. She likes things super simple, don't write how you do for english or other humanities courses. She really expects a lot but this class was super easy and not a ton of work.

I loved professor Brenner, and this class was one of my favorites at UW. It was a lot of reading and daily responses, but the material was so interesting and she was awesome at encouraging class discussion. Lots of presentations, but the class is so small that it is not intimidating. Great class, great professor.
Just don't show up late and you'll be fine.

Professor Brenner is a sweet elderly lady who is very passionate about her lectures.  She is a little behind technology wise and you may have to assist her with the projector - A Lot.  She absolutely hates tardiness so do not be late to this class, she will point you out.  She takes an interest in all her students and really cares about her student

Brenner is really a great lady. She gets a bad rap for being tough but even though you may hate her in the beginning for being hard on you, she is a brilliant educator who gets the best out of you. She is brilliant and very knowledgable and would recommend for anyone looking to learn and challenge themselves.

The human form of Satan… definitely picks favorites, is blunt, doesn't value students even remotely... That being said, she is brilliantly smart. If you have a question about Zionism or Hebrew, she knows the answer. Really great insight into a culture and language other professors may not have.

Though some may not understand her teaching style, if you try your best and work to improve your skills, you will be improve your Hebrew immensely.  Give her a chance and get to know her. Though I was wary in the beginning, she has turned into my favorite professor I have had so far in college and still have a wonderful relationship with her today.

Professor Brenner is one of the hardest professors I've had at Madison, but also one of the best.  However, what you get out of her class is entirely dependent on what you put in.  If you pay attention, work hard and take criticism well, you will learn so much from her and your Hebrew will improve more than you ever thought it could.
If you are wise, you will avoid this professor at all costs. Or prepare to suffer immensely.

I don't know what others are talking about. This professor makes her students feel like complete failures and useless human beings. I lost every ounce of enjoyment I once had for the Hebrew language. Stay away. Far, far, away.
So great!  Loves her students and her subject.  Kind of a curmudgeon.  I hope she stays forever.
Excellent lecturer who always challenges her students.  Can be a bit overbearing at times, but students learn a lot in her classes.  I've taken four, and I hope to take more in the future.
